intro: Krapfia cochlearifolia, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Krapfia cochlearifolia is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid climates with well-drained soil.
